creator: dasan.tmw@gmail.com
text:
hi,
  I have installed openssl and i have installed apache with ssl enabled. while staring apache, segmentaion fault occurs and core dumped.

The version of openssl installed is openssl-0.9.8k.tar.gz and apache is apache_2_0_59.zip.

I have configured apache with the below options,
./configure --enable-so --with-ssl=/openssl --enable-ssl --prefix=/apache

and while starting apache
./bin/httpd -k start
or while checking syntax
./bin/httpd -t
core dumped.
the core dumped is,
# gdb -se ./bin/httpd --core=core 
GNU gdb 6.8

Please reply to this as early as possible,

Thanks and regards,
sathiya.

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
This report is not helpful.  Are your configuration options for real, and if so do you really have openSSL installed to such a strange location and not in any standard place (libssl doesn't feature anywhere in your report, which suggests it isn't there).  Besides, why an old Apache version rather than an up-to-date Apache either from apache.org or Sun's web stack?

Since you have gdb should run it with -X under gdb and get a backtrace.  Unless of course you've long-since fixed it.
